meanings.definition: To pawn or sell something for quick cash.
meanings.sent1: I hocked my old watch to get money for groceries.
meanings.sent2: She hocked her guitar to pay for her rent.
meanings.sent3: He hocked his bike to buy a new video game.
meanings.sent4: The desperate man hocked his wedding ring for a chance at a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: The young girl hocked her necklace to afford a gift for her mom's birthday.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of financial difficulty.
meanings.sent1: After losing his job, he found himself hocked and unable to pay his bills.
meanings.sent2: The company was hocked and struggling to stay afloat.
meanings.sent3: She felt hocked when her car broke down on the highway.
meanings.sent4: Their family was hocked, trying to make ends meet each month.
meanings.sent5: The student was hocked, realizing he had forgotten his wallet at home.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of physical exhaustion.
meanings.sent1: After running the marathon, he was completely hocked and needed to rest.
meanings.sent2: She felt hocked after a long day of hiking in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The dog looked hocked after playing fetch for hours.
meanings.sent4: The tired farmer was hocked from working in the fields all day.
meanings.sent5: The children were hocked after playing tag in the park.
